lead_paragraph: In the streetcar system’s first year, residents often described it as somewhere between disastrous and vaguely satisfactory. And that was when it was free.
snippet: In the streetcar system’s first year, residents often described it as somewhere between disastrous and vaguely satisfactory. And that was when it was free.

headline.main: Atlanta Begins Charging for a Streetcar Named Undesirable by Some
headline.print_headline: In Atlanta, a Ride Many Scorn Is No Longer Free

abstract: Atlanta's 2.7-mile, $98 million streetcar system begins charging passengers fare for first time; system, in operation for a year, has been criticized by many city residents for its inefficiency even when it was free, and even its supporters acknowledge that introduction has not been entirely successful.
